title: Auto Insurance Underwriting Guidelines
content:
Auto insurance underwriting guidelines:
                1. Age factor: Drivers under 25 and over 65 have higher risk
                2. Driving record: Clean record for 3+ years preferred
                3. Vehicle type: Sports cars and luxury vehicles have higher premiums
                4. Usage: Commercial use increases risk significantly
                5. Location: Urban areas have higher claim frequency
                6. Credit score: Lower credit scores correlate with higher claims

title: Property Insurance Risk Assessment
content:
Property insurance risk factors:
                1. Location: Flood zones, earthquake areas, high-crime neighborhoods
                2. Property age: Older properties have higher maintenance risks
                3. Construction type: Frame vs brick construction affects risk
                4. Occupancy: Owner-occupied vs rental properties
                5. Security features: Alarm systems, deadbolts reduce risk
                6. Previous claims: History of water damage, fire claims

title: Health Insurance Underwriting Criteria
content:
Health insurance underwriting considerations:
                1. Pre-existing conditions: Must be disclosed and evaluated
                2. Age and gender: Affects premium calculations
                3. Lifestyle factors: Smoking, alcohol consumption, exercise habits
                4. Family history: Genetic predispositions to certain conditions
                5. Occupation: High-risk jobs increase premiums
                6. Geographic location: Healthcare costs vary by region

title: Case Study: High-Risk Auto Claim
content:
Case Study - High-Risk Auto Claim:
                Policyholder: 22-year-old male, single, student
                Vehicle: 2020 sports car, high-performance
                Driving record: 2 speeding tickets in past year
                Claim: Total loss accident, $45,000 damage
                Outcome: Policy non-renewed due to high risk profile
                Lessons: Young drivers with sports cars and violations
                represent significant underwriting risk.

title: Case Study: Property Water Damage
content:
Case Study - Property Water Damage:
                Property: 15-year-old single-family home
                Location: Flood-prone area, previous water damage
                Claim: Basement flooding, $25,000 damage
                Investigation: Found unmaintained sump pump
                Outcome: Claim paid but policy terms modified
                Prevention: Regular maintenance inspections required

title: Risk Scoring Methodology
content:
Risk Scoring Methodology:
                1. Financial Health (30%): Income, credit score, debt-to-income
                2. Claims History (25%): Frequency, severity, time since last claim
                3. Policy Compliance (20%): Payment history, policy adherence
                4. External Factors (15%): Location, economic conditions
                5. Document Quality (10%): Completeness, accuracy of information
                
                Scoring Scale: 0-100 (0=lowest risk, 100=highest risk)
                Thresholds: Low (0-30), Medium (31-60), High (61-80), Critical (81-100)
